item.title: Boy, 14, accidentally shoots friend in the head while playing with gun, authorities say
item.description: A shooting in Ohio has left a teen dead and another teenager under arrest.

item.title: Atlantic storms Humberto and Imelda could dance in rare Fujiwhara effect
item.description: Atlantic storms Humberto and Imelda could dance in rare Fujiwhara effect

item.title: Air Force veteran and family are gifted a new, mortgage-free home
item.description: The Beesting family's house was completely destroyed in 2022 by Hurricane Ian.

item.title: Ananda Farm reopens in Manatee County with fall festival and pumpkin patch
Man admits in chilling TV interview to killing and burying his parents
item.description: A man admitted during a television interview to killing his parents and burying them in the backyard.

item.title: Flesh-eating larva found in cattle near U.S.-Mexican border
item.description: The latest case of the flesh-eating parasite was detected less than 70 miles from the U.S. border.

item.title: GOP lawmaker accused of sharing child sex abuse videos using ‘joebidennnn69’ screen name to plead guilty
item.description: A former lawmaker charged with nearly a dozen counts of distributing child sex abuse material will plead guilty.

item.title: DNA evidence links a dead man to the 1991 killings of 4 girls at yogurt shop
item.description: DNA evidence has helped to identify a man who died decades ago as a new suspect in the 1991 killing of four teenage girls.

item.title: There’s still work to be done at Tropic Isles one year after Hurricane Helene
item.description: The apocalypse... That is how one team member of Tropic Isles explained the aftermath of Helene.

item.title: Cortez businesses thrive one year after Hurricane Helene
item.description: Restaurants like Star Fish Company completely lost portions of their building but have spent the last year rebuilding and are now thriving.

item.title: Barrier islands bouncing back a year after Helene
item.description: 'I think it’s going to be a big piece of our story as far as rebuilding,' one store owner said.

item.title: Parts of Florida in the cone for new storm
item.description: The first cone for what will become Imelda is out and includes parts of NE Florida.
